articles.title: Hytale Is Not On Steam And May Never Be
articles.summary: Hytale is finally out now, after 10 years of development. If you're looking for the game on Steam, you won't find it there because developer Hypixel launched the game exclusively through its own app. But why is Hytale not on Steam, and could it ever be released there? Here's what we know.Why not Steam?Executive producer Patrick Derbic said in a FAQ that Hypixel opted to release Hytale through its own launcher at first to allow the team to communicate more closely with its own fans and community. Derbic said bringing the game to Steam at launch might have brought a "flood of cold first impressions that could overcorrect the game's direction."This isn't to say that Hypixel wants to bury its head in the sand and avoid criticism, however. The studio said it does not shy away from "honest, negative criticism," going on to say the developer itself has been "very critical" of the game it's making. Releasing on Hytale's own dedicated launcher was a purposeful decision the studio made to help ensure "the first steps of our journey to be influenced by informed players rather than large-scale first impressions from those unfamiliar with the game's development background."Continue Reading at GameSpot
articles.long_summary: Hytale is finally out now, after 10 years of development. If you're looking for the game on Steam, you won't find it there because developer Hypixel launched the game exclusively through its own app. But why is Hytale not on Steam, and could it ever be released there? Here's what we know.Why not Steam?Executive producer Patrick Derbic said in a FAQ that Hypixel opted to release Hytale through its own launcher at first to allow the team to communicate more closely with its own fans and community.

articles.title: Hytale Devs Are Paying $25K Bounty For Serious Bugs
articles.summary: Hytale is out today in early access a mere six months after it was canceled by Riot Games. Developer Hypixel warned players ahead of time that the game was unfinished and still has bugs. But the studio is taking a big step towards ensuring the security of Hytale by paying out $25,000 bounties to players who can find and identify serious vulnerabilities in the game."Keeping our community and players safe is a top priority for us," wrote one of the devs on X. "We've already paid out bounties and are working on reported issues as they come in."In addition to setting the rate for $25,000, the message notes that some payouts may go over that amount depending upon the severity of the issues uncovered.Continue Reading at GameSpot

articles.title: President Trump wants Japan's tiny kei cars to be sold in the US
articles.summary:
The kei class limits cars to strict dimensions, engine capacity and even power output 

US president Donald Trump has reiterated that he is open to Chinese and other foreign manufacturers building cars in the country â€“ and he has even told Fordâ€™s boss that he wants kei cars to be sold in America.
Trump made his comments on a trip to Michigan, where he toured the plant in which Ford manufactures the F-150 pick-up â€“ Americaâ€™s best-selling vehicle â€“ and deliveredÂ a speech at the Detroit Economic Club.
The US government has imposed heavy tariffs on foreign cars being imported into the US, including a 100% rate on vehiclesÂ made in China that has effectively shut out Chinese firms from the market. But he has repeatedly said he is open to foreign manufacturers building factories in the US.
â€œLet China come in. Let Japan come in,â€ said Trump during his speech. â€œThey are and theyâ€™ll be building plants, and using our labour."
Later, speaking during his tour of the Ford plant, Trump reportedly said that having cars built in the US was his top priority, adding: â€œWe want cars built here. They [US car firms] are all doing great. The car industry is exciting. Every industry is exciting.â€
Ford has recently expanded F-150 production at its Michigan plantÂ and Trump said that was â€œbecause of tariffsâ€ he had introduced. He also said his decision to roll back many environmental targets in the country has boosted the car industry, insisting â€œthe environmentalists would not let them surviveâ€.
Speaking to media ahead of the Detroit Auto Show, Ford boss Jim Farley said Trumpâ€™s visit was because â€œthe president really wanted to see for himself the effect of his policies on the most important automotive plant in the United Statesâ€.
Farley added that the F-150 is â€œsecond to the iPhone in total revenues for a consumer product globally, but we make all of ours in the USâ€, which, he said, made the F-150 factory and its sibling plant â€œthe two most important American revenues plants in the countryâ€.
Ford has recently added 1200 jobs by expanding production at the two lines and Farley saidÂ Trump â€œwanted to see those 1200 new jobs, he wanted to meet the factory workers themselves, and he wanted to learn about how these jobs change people's livesâ€.
Farley was subsequently asked by Japanese media if the F-150 could ever be exported to Japan. While he dismissed that notion, he revealed Trump has asked him about the prospects of small Japanese-market kei cars â€“Â which are limited in size and power output â€“ being offered in the US.
â€œThe president today asked: â€˜Can we sell kei cars in the US?â€™â€ said Farley. â€œThatâ€™s exciting and fun to talkÂ about those possibilities.â€
Asked how Farley responded to that kei car request, the Ford CEO highlighted his time at Toyotaâ€™s now-defunct Scion brand, a youth-focused marque that offered a range of small cars. â€œAt Scion I brought xB [a compact hatchback] to the country. I love that little car. Weâ€™ll continue to look at the market: affordability is a priority for us, but frankly a small minivan for six people in the US, Iâ€™m not sure thatâ€™s going to be a high taker.â€
articles.long_summary:
The kei class limits cars to strict dimensions, engine capacity and even power output

articles.title: Forza Horizon 6 Release Date May Have Leaked Ahead Of Next Week's Developer Direct
articles.summary: Forza Horizon 6 is one of several games set to headline a new Developer Direct livestream from Xbox, and it looks like the game's release date may have leaked early. According to the leaks, Forza Horizon 6 will reportedly launch on May 19, while the Premium Edition of the game will allow buyers to start playing four days early on May 15.Xbox Infinite--an Xbox news site based in Saudi Arabia--posted an image of what it claims is an in-game announcement from Forza Horizon 5, detailing the Forza Horizon 6 release date and DLC that will be available in the Premium Edition. VGC corroborated the claims, saying that its sources had confirmed that this is the correct release date for the game. According to the image, the Premium Edition will offer early access, VIP membership, car packs, an exclusive Ferrari, and post-launch car pack DLC.ğŸŸ©| Ø¹Ø§Ø¬Ù„ ÙˆØ­ØµØ±ÙŠ ğŸš¨ğŸš¨Ù„Ø¹Ø¨Ø© [ Forza Horizon 6 ] Ø³ØªØµØ¯Ø± ÙÙŠ 19 Ù…Ø§ÙŠÙˆ 2026â€¢ Ø¥Ø¹Ù„Ø§Ù† Ø¸Ù‡Ø± Ø¯Ø§Ø®Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ø¹Ø¨Ø© pic.twitter.com/vW1RVI7roP  â€” XBOX INFINITE (@XBOXF10) January 14, 2026              Forza Horizon 6 was officially revealed ahead of the Xbox showcase at Tokyo Game Show last year, and the next chapter in the racing series will see the Horizon Festival move to Japan. It'll launch on PC and Xbox Series X|S first, with a PS5 release date to follow. Forza Horizon 5 launched on PS5 last year, and the game proved a huge success on the Sony platform, selling over 5.1 million units.Continue Reading at GameSpot

articles.title: Eidos Montreal Is Reportedly Working On A Big-Budget Game Similar To Wild
articles.summary: The canceled open-world game Wild may get a spiritual successor of sorts from Deus Ex: Human Revolution developer Eidos Montreal. According to Insider Gaming, the unannounced title is codenamed P11 and features intriguing likenesses to the canned Ubisoft game.The report also states that P11 has been in development since 2019, with Unreal Engine 5 powering the project. However, Insider Gaming adds there have been "significant setbacks" for the game. In 2024, Embracer Group canned a Deus Ex game in development and cut 97 people from Eidos Montreal. The layoffs didn't stop there, either. Last year, another 75 employees lost their jobs at the studio.As for P11, an X user named Timur222 found that an Eidos Montreal employee on LinkedIn refers to the project as a "AAAA" game. Insider Gaming initially thought that Embracer may have somehow acquired the Wild rights from Ubisoft because this project looks so similar. Wild was revealed in 2014, showing players riding a bear and even assuming the control of an eagle and rabbit. The PlayStation exclusive was reportedly canceled in 2021.Continue Reading at GameSpot
articles.long_summary: The canceled open-world game Wild may get a spiritual successor of sorts from Deus Ex: Human Revolution developer Eidos Montreal. According to Insider Gaming, the unannounced title is codenamed P11 and features intriguing likenesses to the canned Ubisoft game.The report also states that P11 has been in development since 2019, with Unreal Engine 5 powering the project. However, Insider Gaming adds there have been "significant setbacks" for the game. In 2024, Embracer Group canned a Deus Ex game i

articles.title: Scientists finally uncover why statins cause muscle pain
articles.summary: A new discovery may explain why so many people abandon cholesterol-lowering statins because of muscle pain and weakness. Researchers found that certain statins can latch onto a key muscle protein and trigger a tiny but harmful calcium leak inside muscle cells. That leak may weaken muscles directly or activate processes that slowly break them down, offering a long-sought explanation for statin-related aches.
articles.long_summary: A new discovery may explain why so many people abandon cholesterol-lowering statins because of muscle pain and weakness. Researchers found that certain statins can latch onto a key muscle protein and trigger a tiny but harmful calcium leak inside muscle cells. That leak may weaken muscles directly or activate processes that slowly break them down, offering a long-sought explanation for statin-related aches.
